name: Mindful Breathing
description: Focus on your breath and calm the mind through controlled breathing patterns.
posture: Sit upright comfortably with feet flat on floor, hands resting on knees or in lap.
steps: Find a quiet space and sit comfortably with eyes closed.
Place one hand on chest, one on belly to feel breath movement.
Inhale slowly through the nose for 4 counts.
Hold your breath gently for 4 counts.
Exhale slowly through mouth for 6 counts.
Notice the natural pause between breaths.
Repeat this cycle, focusing solely on the breath.
When mind wanders, gently return attention to breathing.

name: Body Scan Meditation
description: Systematically focus on different parts of your body to release tension and increase awareness.
posture: Lie down flat on your back with arms at sides, palms facing up, legs slightly apart.
steps: Lie down comfortably and close your eyes.
Take three deep breaths to settle in.
Start at the top of your head, noticing any sensations.
Slowly move attention to forehead, eyes, jaw, and neck.
Progress through shoulders, arms, and hands.
Focus on chest, heart, and breathing.
Move to stomach, back, and lower torso.
Continue with hips, thighs, knees, and calves.
End with feet and toes.
Notice your whole body as one complete unit.

name: Loving-Kindness Meditation
description: Cultivate compassion and goodwill toward yourself and others through directed well-wishes.
posture: Sit comfortably with spine straight, hands in lap, gentle smile on face.
steps: Begin by directing loving-kindness toward yourself.
Repeat: 'May I be happy, may I be healthy, may I be at peace.'
Feel the intention behind these words.
Extend these wishes to a loved one.
Visualize them and repeat the phrases for them.
Include a neutral person (acquaintance or stranger).
Challenge yourself with someone you have difficulties with.
Expand to include all beings in your community.
End by sending loving-kindness to all living beings everywhere.

name: Walking Meditation
description: Practice mindfulness while walking slowly and deliberately, connecting with each step.
posture: Stand tall with arms relaxed at sides or hands clasped behind back.
steps: Choose a quiet path 10-20 steps long.
Stand at one end and take a moment to center yourself.
Begin walking slower than normal pace.
Focus on the sensation of lifting each foot.
Notice the movement of your leg through air.
Feel the foot touching the ground.
Observe weight shifting from one foot to another.
When you reach the end, pause and turn mindfully.
Continue walking back and forth along your path.
If mind wanders, stop and refocus on your feet.

name: Visualization Meditation
description: Use guided imagery to create peaceful mental scenes and promote deep relaxation.
posture: Sit or lie down comfortably with eyes closed.
steps: Close your eyes and take several deep breaths.
Imagine a peaceful place (beach, forest, mountain).
Engage all your senses in this visualization.
See the colors, shapes, and lighting.
Hear the sounds (waves, birds, wind).
Feel the temperature and textures.
Smell the natural scents around you.
Spend time exploring this peaceful space.
When ready, slowly return to the present moment.
Open your eyes gradually and sit quietly.

name: Mantra Meditation
description: Repeat a sacred word or phrase to focus the mind and transcend ordinary thinking.
posture: Sit cross-legged or in chair with spine erect, hands in mudra position.
steps: Choose a mantra ('Om', 'Peace', 'So Hum', or personal phrase).
Sit comfortably and close your eyes.
Begin repeating your mantra silently.
Coordinate the mantra with your breath if helpful.
When thoughts arise, gently return to the mantra.
Don't force or strain - let it flow naturally.
If you lose the mantra, simply begin again.
Continue for your chosen duration.
End with a few moments of silence.
Gradually open your eyes and sit quietly.

name: Mindful Eating Meditation
description: Practice mindfulness while eating to enhance awareness of taste, texture, and satisfaction.
posture: Sit at table with good posture, food placed in front of you.
steps: Choose a simple food item (raisin, apple, piece of bread).
Hold the food and examine it visually.
Notice colors, shapes, textures, and imperfections.
Smell the food and notice any aromas.
Feel the weight and texture in your hand.
Take a small bite and pause before chewing.
Chew slowly, noticing flavors and textures.
Be aware of the urge to swallow.
Notice how the food changes as you chew.
Swallow mindfully and pause between bites.
Continue eating with full attention and gratitude.

name: Zen Meditation (Zazen)
description: Traditional Zen practice of 'just sitting' - observing thoughts without attachment.
posture: Sit in lotus position or on cushion, spine straight, eyes slightly open gazing downward.
steps: Sit in traditional meditation posture.
Keep eyes slightly open, gazing at floor 3 feet ahead.
Rest hands in cosmic mudra (left hand on right).
Breathe naturally without controlling breath.
Simply observe whatever arises in awareness.
Don't follow thoughts or push them away.
When you notice thinking, just return to sitting.
Maintain alertness without effort or strain.
If drowsy, straighten posture and open eyes wider.
Continue 'just sitting' for entire session.

name: Chakra Meditation
description: Focus on the seven energy centers of the body to promote balance and healing.
posture: Sit comfortably with spine straight, hands resting on knees.
steps: Begin with several deep breaths to center yourself.
Visualize red light at base of spine (Root Chakra).
Move to orange light below navel (Sacral Chakra).
Focus on yellow light at solar plexus (Solar Plexus Chakra).
Visualize green light at heart center (Heart Chakra).
See blue light at throat (Throat Chakra).
Focus on indigo light between eyebrows (Third Eye Chakra).
Visualize violet light at top of head (Crown Chakra).
See all chakras spinning and glowing simultaneously.
End by visualizing white light flowing through all centers.

name: Sound Meditation
description: Use bells, bowls, or nature sounds as focal points for meditation practice.
posture: Sit comfortably with eyes closed, hands relaxed in lap.
steps: Choose your sound source (singing bowl, bell, nature sounds).
Sit comfortably and close your eyes.
Strike the bell or start your sound.
Focus completely on the sound as it emerges.
Follow the sound until it completely fades.
Notice the silence that follows.
Repeat with next sound when ready.
If using continuous sound, focus on different qualities.
Notice pitch, tone, vibration, and resonance.
Let the sound wash over and through you.
End with a few moments of complete silence.
